page.title: 05Beswick: Work Opportunities
page.content: Apart from agriculture, with its now limited employment opportunities, there is little scope for employment within the area. Around one-fifth of the population are children; and of the adult population a high proportion are pensioners. Of the working population relatively few are actually employed within the designated region. Several "commuter" families reside in the area, travelling to work in Beverley, Hull, Driffield or Bridlington. Local businesses include joinery and undertaking, building services and motor vehicle repairs. These are one-man or family concerns, casual local labour occasionally being used. Most female employment is part-time in nature - domestic cleaning, ancillary school-work or shop-work. Beswick post office also provides part-time work.
